H0.text: when did new york stop using the electric chair. 1963

H1.text: when did new york stop using the electric chair. 1985

H2.text: when did new york stop using the electric chair. 1951

H3.text: when did new york stop using the electric chair. 1972

A4.text: The last execution in New York using the electric chair occurred in 1963 when Eddie Lee Mays was electrocuted at Sing Sing prison.

A5.text: There were no executions in New York after the reinstatement of the death penalty before it was abolished again on June 24, 2004.
